N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 ยง 473.6 - Increases in maximum gross weight or unloaded weight

State Regulations

Tax Law, ยง 502
(a) In the event of any increase in the
maximum gross weight or unloaded weight of a motor vehicle, a request for an
amended permit must be made to the State Tax Commission, Miscellaneous Tax

Bureau, by letter. The request must contain the carrier's name, address, employer identification number (but if the carrier has no employer
identification number, then the carrier's social security account number), the
permit number assigned by the Miscellaneous Tax Bureau to the vehicle whose
weight is to be revised, and the new maximum gross weight or unloaded weight of
such vehicle. (b) In the event a
special hauling permit is obtained pursuant to section
385
of the Vehicle and Traffic Law from the

State Department of Transportation, or from any authority having jurisdiction
over a particular highway which authorizes the operation of a motor vehicle
with a maximum gross weight in excess of that set forth in the permit issued
therefor, an amended permit must be obtained as set forth in this section. For
computation of tax in such instances, see section
481.4
(f), infra. Notes
